boat.construction_details: Pitch pine planking on elm ribs, oak and elm centreline structure, oak stem and stern post, teak cabin top and comings.

for_sales.sales_text:
Long keel double ended gaff sloop (LOD 21ft / LWL 20ft 7” / Beam 6ft 9” / Draft 4ft / Disp 4 tonnes). Built 1932 by William Kings and Sons of Burnham-On-Crouch out of the best materials (pitch pine planking on elm ribs, with teak cabin sides/comings). Yanmar GM10 inboard diesel. Stunning classic – pretty and unique, turns heads wherever she goes. Sails beautifully and winner of many gaffers races. Easy to sail single handed – sails can be raised/lowered from cockpit. Comfortable and cosy cabin. Very capable. Fully equipped and ready to sail (incl. new mast June 2013, new rigging 2022, Raymarine tiller pilot, Seagoo tender, bespoke winter cover, ICOM VHF, Digital Yacht AIS, lots of other recent equipment). Well cared for in family ownership. Lying Port Penrhyn, Bangor. 

**Contact: [ollie.snowdon-1@yahoo.com]

boat.full_description:
Long keel double ended gaff sloop (21ft LOD / 20ft 7" LWL), with bowsprit and stern hung rudder. Approx 4 tonnes. Built in 1932 by William Kings and Sons of Burnham-On-Crouch as an enlargered version of Snipe, referred to by East Coast maritime author, Francis B Cooke.

With her current owners, Shearwater has cruised Welsh coasts extensively and undertaken extended trips to Brittany, Cornwall, Scilly Isles, Ireland, Isle of Man and Scotland (incl. Outer Hebrides and the Isle of Skye).
boat.name: Shearwater
